content: off give your tail a tug to tighten it you can now start working in the round @karlijnscorner still not sure check this video tutorial https //youtu be/6p2od3-w6oo purling insert your right needle in the first st on your left needle purlwise from the back to the front wrap your yarn around your right needle pull the wrapped yarn through the first st loop and drop the st that was on your left needle you have now made a purl st @karlijnscorner still not sure check this video tutorial https //youtu be/weei0mxas6o knitting insert your right hand needle in the first st on your left needle knitwise from front to back wrap your yarn around your right hand needle or scoop it up continental style pull the wrapped yarn through the loop of the first st and drop the st that was on your left hand needle you have now made a knit stitch @karlijnscorner still not sure check this video tutorial https //youtu be/4kdel4b-d6m m1r insert your right hand needle in the strand between your needles and transfer the picked up strand to your left needle knit the new st strand on the left needle as you would normally you have now increased 1 st using the m1r method @karlijnscorner still not sure check this video tutorial https //youtu be/dcw5jcqdenk m1l insert your left needle into the strand between your needles this strand will now be seen as an extra st knit this extra st through the back loop you have now increased 1 st using the m1l method @karlijnscorner still not sure check this video tutorial https //youtu be/najn1dqcwkq binding off work your first two sts normally in pattern take the second st on your right needle and carry it over the first st and off your needle you have now bound off 1 st work the next st in pattern and take the second st on your right needle to carry over the first st and off your needle continue doing this until the end of your work or until the pattern says so @karlijnscorner still not sure check this video tutorial https //youtu be/fck7rzr2ona maintaining pattern before increasing you will place a markers so that you have 8 edge stitches on both sides of your top these will continue being your edge stitches throughout the increasing and all increases will be on the inside of the markers when increasing you will want the inside stitches to continue matching the pattern you will change how to increase based on this i if the last two stitches in-between the markers are pp increase knitwise pk increase knitwise kk increase purlwise kp increase purlwise @karlijnscorner nd still not sure check this video tutorial 2 version https //www youtube com/watch v=p- qlgfpxyqw&ab_channel=roxannerichardson measurements @karlijnscorner this pattern is made to measure which means we will be taking our own measurements throughout the pattern and will not be following specific row or stitch counts for guidance with measuring refer to the photos
